DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if spinal manipulative therapy can affect cognitive processing as determined by performance on a Stroop task. It is specifically hypothesized that number of errors and response times will decrease as a result of spinal manipulative therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Influence of Spinal Manipulative Therapy Upon Stroop Task Performance
DOC.criteria: Normal healthy No spinal manipulation one week proceeding trial No stimulants or depressants
